Description: Rectangular fragment of a plaque of grey schist. A cylindrical hole for the perforation appears on both sides, but was not completed, the object probably broke by drilling the perforation. The rear is unsmoothed, front and sides were smoothed, front side is incised with figures or hieroglyphs. Identification is difficult, seated figure on top of a canal-sign or an animal by turning it 90 degrees.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Amara West (Nubia), D14.8A, between levels 1-2
Bibliographic references: Spencer 1997 / Amara West I, The Architectural Report (p. 137)
